edu.rit.pj2.example

Class RandomGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.pj2.example.RandomGraph

  • public class RandomGraph
extends Object
    Class RandomGraph is a main program that generates a random graph. Given a number of vertices V and a number of edges E, the program prints a graph on the standard output consisting of a randomly chosen subset of size E of all possible edges among V vertices. The graph format is as follows: The first line consists of V and E. Each subsequent line consists of two vertex numbers each in the range 0 through V−1, defining an edge between those vertices.

    Usage: java edu.rit.pj2.example.RandomGraph V E seed
    V = Number of vertices, V ≥ 1
    E = Number of edges, 0 ≤ E ≤ V(V−1)/2
    seed = Random seed
